paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient 276 carried both BRCA2 p.R3128X and ATM p.R248X. She was diagnosed with receptor-positive breast cancer at age 31.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is predicted to result in a truncated protein, leading to loss of function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is associated with a high risk of breast cancer.
key_quotes: The majority of mutations were found in BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes.
Identifying inherited mutations in breast cancer patients is important for at least three reasons.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient 312 carried both CHEK2 p.R160G and ATM p.R457X. She was diagnosed with stage 3, receptor-positive breast cancer at age 34.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is predicted to result in a truncated protein, leading to loss of function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is associated with a high risk of breast cancer.
key_quotes: The majority of mutations were found in BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes.
Identifying inherited mutations in breast cancer patients is important for at least three reasons.

tables_processed.table_caption: Germline mutations in African American patients with primary breast cancer with young age at diagnosis (Br dx <45), family history of breast cancer younger than age 60 (FH Br <60) or of ovarian cancer (FH Ov), or triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC)

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
